formattedAddress: 504 Main St, New York, NY 10044, USA
adrFormatAddress: 504 Main St, New York, NY 10044, USA

originalText.text: A conveniently positioned library catering to guests & cardholders alike! The Reference Desk was super friendly & courteous! The youngsters really seem to enjoy The Children's Room. There was a vast selection of books & computers available for usage. The hours were also useful to what we may deem as a "normal" person's schedule. The printing was very easy for a guest as well with a nominal fee of 20¬¢ per black & white copy.

originalText.text:
On Wednesday 11/16/23, I arrived at my 4PM appointment to have a private computer session with Librarian Julia. She was extremely friendly, patient, reassuring and efficient. She explained the basic functions of how to navigate how to sign in, web search and other details.
I left feeling a lot more confident after her instructing me. I'm looking forward to having future computer sessions with her. She is the coolest üòé.
I give Julia FIVE ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê!!!

originalText.text: Friendly staff, great programming, clean bathrooms, many books. Sometimes my kids run around like little psychos and bother the other google reviewers. I try to make them stop but it‚Äôs very difficult because they won‚Äôt listen when they‚Äôre all hopped up on literacy.

originalText.text:
As a long-time Island resident I have been using this library for years and have always appreciated it.  Once it was renovated and expanded, unfortunately it became a children‚Äôs playground. Although they supposedly have a designated section in the back, the children run around, scream, play and nobody is able to curtail them. I have spoken to staff and the manager but they are powerless. The parents don‚Äôt even seem to think this is inappropriate in a library setting and they let them behave like this.

I usually just go in and out quickly but was forced to work there for a few days as my laptop was being repaired. Any focused work was impossible even with headphones set at the highest volume. There was constantly some kid sprinting at full speed next to me or a baby crying at the top of its lungs. It‚Äôs a shame that parents nowadays don‚Äôt teach their children how to behave in a public library. And it‚Äôs a shame the staff isn‚Äôt able to implement some rules. After all, public libraries belong to adults as well. Alternately, they can designate this as a children‚Äôs library so adults without offspring can keep away.

originalText.text: Extremely rude, curt staff. Every other public library in the city is a really wonderful and welcoming space. It‚Äôs really a shame that this is the only library on Roosevelt Island. People deserve better.
